title: (b) have considered whether an environmental impact assessment or
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Planning and Development Act 2000
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Planning and Development Act 2000 

(Section 181(2)(a)) Order 2022. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [478] 3

title: (b) have considered whether an environmental impact assessment or
heading: 2. The Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) (other than
text_raw:
2. The Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) (other than 
sections 50, 50A, 50B and 181 of that Act) shall not apply, pursuant to 
subsections (2) to (2AA) of section 181 of that Act, to the development 
described in Part 1 of the Schedule proposed to be carried out by or on behalf 
of EirGrid, a statutory undertaker for the purposes of section 181 of the 
Planning and Development Act (No. 30 of 2000).
text_norm: 2 planning development act 2000 (no 30 2000) (other section 50 50a 50b 181 act) shall apply pursuant subsection (2) (2aa) section 181 act development described part 1 schedule proposed carried behalf eirgrid statutory undertaker purpose section 181 planning development act (no 30 2000)

title: (b) have considered whether an environmental impact assessment or
heading: Site: The existing North Wall Power Generating Station, which is, for ease
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Part 1 

Site: The existing North Wall Power Generating Station, which is, for ease 
of reference, outlined in red on the maps set out in Part 2. 

Address: 

Alexandra Road, Dublin 1 

Description: Temporary emergency electricity generating plant 
to be 
provided within the existing North Wall Power Generating Station, and 
comprising: 

Six 35-megawatt electrical nominal capacity gas turbine units of modular 
design. Each gas turbine module will include an 11-metre-tall stack, air intake 
filters, exhaust silencer and ancillaries; 

Six control house modules (3.39 metres tall) and three power control modules 
(5.5 metres tall); 

Three natural gas compressors (3.14 metres tall) each with an associated finfan cooler; 

A 1,250 metre cubed water storage tank (14.5 metres tall) for potable and 
firefighting purposes together with associated pumphouse; 

Two air compressors (2.5 metres tall), electrical reactors, pipe and cable racks; 

Modifications to existing surface water drainage system; 

Revised internal road layout and minor ancillary plant and equipment 
structures including bunded storage areas; and, 

The demolition of existing structures including gas compressor building, 
decommissioned 38kV substation building, fuel oil pump house, gate keeper’s 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [478] 

house, air inlet filter house and electrical house and other minor redundant 
installations. 

The proposed development will also include necessary preliminary site works, 
civil and ancillary works required to enable the construction and operation of 
the facility. 

Part 2 

Site Location Map 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Proposed Site Layout Plan 

[478] 5 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [478] 

Proposed Site Demolition Plan 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 September, 2022. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, 
Climate and Communications. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [478] 7
